channel.title: [718] Loader.class not found in webclient
channel.description:
Alright, I found out how to add my webclient to my website. (My server is 718) Now I get this error:
[url=http://prntscr.com/14t4q4]Screenshot by Lightshot[/url]
[CODE]Java Plug-in 10.21.2.11 Using JRE version 1.7.0_21-b11 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM User home directory = C:\Users\Tony ---------------------------------------------------- c: clear console window f: finalize objects on finalization queue g: garbage collect h: display this help message l: dump classloader list m: print memory usage o: trigger logging q: hide console r: reload policy configuration s: dump system and deployment properties t: dump thread list v: dump thread stack x: clear classloader cache 0-5: set trace level to <n> ---------------------------------------------------- [/CODE]
Anyone know how to fix this? I set my manifest to Loader because it was the only one that worked.

item.title: [718] Loader.class not found in webclient
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You know… I mean, it’s not hard to find the main class. Just right click the client’s run.bat and hit edit…

Read full topic

item.title: [718] Loader.class not found in webclient
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I have never jarred a higher revision however I assume the loader class is equivalent to the client class on a 317? If so you need to make sure you put it as “loader” and not “Loader” in the manifest (sounds stupid I know…) but I had this issue before. I would put “Client” and it would give me that error.

Read full topic

item.title: [718] Loader.class not found in webclient
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:519231”]Are you fucking serious? Your last topic was moved because it was in the wrong section, so you make another one in the wrong section? Really?
I’d give you an infraction if I was mod -.-[/quote]
Doesn’t really warrant an infraction since there hasn’t been any warning beforehand, not that I can infract anyway, sectional problems :(.

OT: don’t rely on moderators to move your post, if you continue to post in the wrong board (what seems deliberately) you will be infracted then.

Read full topic
